org.interledger

インタフェース InterledgerAddress

  • 既知の実装クラスのリスト:
    InterledgerAddress.AbstractInterledgerAddress

    public interface InterledgerAddress
    Interledger Protocol (ILP) Addresses identify Ledger accounts (or groups of Ledger accounts) in an ILP network, and provide a way to route a payment to its intended destination.

    Interledger Addresses can be subdivided into two categories:

    Destination Addresses are complete addresses that can receive payments. A destination address always maps to one account in a ledger, though it can also provide more specific information, such as an invoice ID or a sub-account. Destination addresses MUST NOT end in a period (.) character.

    Address Prefixes are incomplete addresses representing a grouping of destination addresses. Many depths of grouping are possible, for example: groups of accounts or sub-accounts; an individual ledger or sub-ledger; or entire neighborhoods of ledgers. Address prefixes MUST end in a period (.) character.

    The formal specification for an Interledger Addresses is defined in Interledger RFC #15.

    関連項目:
    "https://github.com/interledger/rfcs/tree/master/0015-ilp-addresses"

    • メソッドの詳細

      • of

        static InterledgerAddress of(String value)
        Constructor to allow quick construction from a String representation of an ILP address.
        パラメータ:
        value - String representation of an Interledger Address
        戻り値:
        an InterledgerAddress instance.

      • isValid

        static boolean isValid(String value)
        Helper method to determine if an Interledger Address conforms to the specifications outlined in Interledger RFC #15.
        パラメータ:
        value - A String representing a potential Interledger Address value.
        戻り値:
        true if the supplied value conforms to the requirements of RFC 15; false otherwise.
        関連項目:
        "https://github.com/interledger/rfcs/tree/master/0015-ilp-addresses"

      • requireAddressPrefix

        static InterledgerAddress requireAddressPrefix(InterledgerAddress addressPrefix)
        Checks and requires that the specified addressPrefix is an address prefix per isLedgerPrefix().

        This method is designed primarily for doing parameter validation in methods and constructors, as demonstrated below:

         public Foo(InterledgerAddress bar) {
     this.ledgerPrefix = InterledgerAddress.requireAddressPrefix(bar);
 }
        パラメータ:
        addressPrefix - A InterledgerAddress to check.
        戻り値:
        ledgerPrefix if its value ends with a dot (.).
        例外:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied Interledger address is not a ledger-prefix.

      • requireNotAddressPrefix

        static InterledgerAddress requireNotAddressPrefix(InterledgerAddress addressPrefix)
        Checks and requires that the specified addressPrefix is not an address prefix per isLedgerPrefix().

        This method is designed primarily for doing parameter validation in methods and constructors, as demonstrated below:

         public Foo(InterledgerAddress bar) {
     this.nonLedgerPrefix = InterledgerAddress.requireNotAddressPrefix(bar);
 }
        パラメータ:
        addressPrefix - A InterledgerAddress to check.
        戻り値:
        addressPrefix if its value ends with a dot (.).
        例外:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied Interledger address is not a ledger-prefix.

      • builder

        static InterledgerAddressBuilder builder()
        Get the default builder.
        戻り値:
        a InterledgerAddressBuilder instance.

      • getValue

        String getValue()
        Return this address's value as a non-null String. For example: us.usd.bank.account
        戻り値:
        A String representation of this Interledger address.

      • isLedgerPrefix

        default boolean isLedgerPrefix()
        Tests if this Interledger address represents a ledger prefix.
        戻り値:
        True if the address is a ledger prefix, false otherwise.

      • startsWith

        default boolean startsWith(String addressSegment)
        Tests if this InterledgerAddress starts with the specified addressSegment.
        パラメータ:
        addressSegment - An String prefix to compare against.
        戻り値:
        true if this InterledgerAddress begins with the specified prefix.

      • startsWith

        default boolean startsWith(InterledgerAddress interledgerAddress)
        Tests if this InterledgerAddress starts with the specified interledgerAddress.
        パラメータ:
        interledgerAddress - An InterledgerAddress prefix to compare against.
        戻り値:
        true if this InterledgerAddress begins with the specified prefix.

      • with

        default InterledgerAddress with(String addressSegment)

        Return a new InterledgerAddress by postfixing the supplied segment to this address.

        This method can be used to construct both address prefixes and destination addresses. For example, if the value of this address is 'us.usd.', then calling this method with an argument of 'bob' would result in a new Interledger Address with a value of 'us.usd.bob', which is a destination address.

        Likewise, if the value of this address is 'us.usd.pacific.', then calling this method with an argument of 'creditunions.' would result in a new Interledger Address with a value of 'us.usd.pacific.creditunions.', which is an address prefix.

        パラメータ:
        addressSegment - A String to be appended to this address as an additional segment.
        戻り値:
        A new instance representing the original address with a newly specified final segment.

      • getPrefix

        default InterledgerAddress getPrefix()

        Return this address's prefix, which is a new InterledgerAddress containing the characters inside of getValue(), up-to and including the last period. If this address is already a prefix, then this instance is instead returned unchanged.

        For example, calling this method on an address 'g.example.alice' would yield a new address containing 'g.example.'. Conversely, calling this method on an address that is already a prefix, like 'g.example.' would yield the same instance, 'g.example.'.

        戻り値:
        A potentially new InterledgerAddress representing the prefix of this address.

      • getParentPrefix

        default Optional<InterledgerAddress> getParentPrefix()

        Return this address's parent prefix.

        If this address is a destination address, then this method returns a new InterledgerAddress containing the characters inside of getValue(), up-to and including last period. If this address is instead a prefix, then this instance returns a new InterledgerAddress containing the characters inside of getValue(), up-to and including second-to-last period, unless this address is a root prefix, in which case, Optional.empty() is returned.

        For example, calling this method on an address 'g.example.alice' would yield a new address containing 'g.example.'. Likewise, calling this method on an address that is already a prefix, like 'g.example.' would yield 'g.'. Finally, calling this method on a root prefix, like "self." would yield Optional.empty().

        戻り値:
        An optionally present parent-prefix.

      • hasParentPrefix

        default boolean hasParentPrefix()

        Determines if this ILP Address has a parent-prefix.

        If this address is a destination address, then it has a parent prefix. However, if the address is a prefix, then it only has a parent if it is _not_ a Root Prefix.

        戻り値:
        true if this address is a destination address. Otherwise (if this address is a prefix address), then return false if this address is a Root prefix; otherwise, return true.

      • isRootPrefix

        default boolean isRootPrefix()

        Determines if this address is a "root" prefix, which per ILP-RFC-15, is one of: "g.", "private.", "example.", "peer.", "self.", "test1.", "test2.", or "test3.". Any other kind of valid ILP address (e.g. "g.1") is not a root prefix.

        戻り値:
        true if this address is a root prefix; false otherwise.
